wikipedia_page.main: Benjamin Albert Olney (30 March 1899 – 23 September 1943) was an English international footballer, who played as a goalkeeper.

response: Olney was born in 1914 in St Bartholomew's Parish, Birmingham, the son of James Ferd Olney, a brass fitter, and his wife Harriet Florence née Brown. He had an older sister, Ivy May. His father's younger brother, Ben Olney, played football as a goalkeeper for Derby County, Aston Villa and England.
